medical_history.chief_complaint: Clinical signs of Brugada syndrome, including multiple episodes of ventricular fibrillation.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was successfully resuscitated from ventricular fibrillation in 1992. A procainamide provocation test in the same year increased ST-segment elevation from 2.5 to 3.5 mm in precordial ECG leads. Over time, the patient experienced many VF episodes that were resistant to antiarrhythmic drugs, leading to intolerable shocked episodes by the ICD prior to cardiac transplantation in February 2002.
medical_history.past_medical_history: No structurally detected cardiac abnormalities; however, there was mild tricuspid regurgitation and slightly enlarged right ventricular diameter.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's brother died suddenly at age 32; the mother displayed an ECG sign of BS without provocations, and the father had no signs. Neither of the patient’s two sons nor his brother’s two sons had signs of BS.
